Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Description: The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission announced that nine children's product manufacturers, importers and sellers agreed to pay a total of more than $500,000 in civil penalties for allegedly violating the federal lead paint ban.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Description: Hobby Lobby agreed to pay a fine of $3 million to settle allegations that it acquired mislabeled shipments of ancient artifacts that had been smuggled out of Iraq. It also agreed to forfeit thousands of the artifacts, which had been descripbed in customs documents as tile samples.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Eastern District of New York

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
